summary: Saint Helena is a remote British island in the South Atlantic Ocean, about 1,200 miles west of Africa. It's a volcanic and tropical island, and one of the most isolated major islands globally. Discovered in 1502, it was an essential stop for ships traveling between Europe and Asia before the Suez Canal opened. Saint Helena is known for being where Napoleon was exiled after his defeat in 1815. Today, it has an airport, and its 2021 population was around 4,400 people.
title: Saint Helena
